section.title: Quality Assurance
section.para: Quality Assurance (QA) rules flag terminologies that have broken concept rules, including domain attribute errors and description duplicates. These QA rules are executed in the QA tab or as part of creating a version. To execute QA rules, select "QA" from the Task panel tabs and click "Run QA Test".
Once the QA test has completed its analysis details can be viewed by clicking on the test in the QA Run List. Refresh the list if necessary.

note.para: At this time, QA rules check for "active concepts should not contain tabs, newlines, or characters @, $, #, \\." Additional rules will be implemented at a later time.

section.title: Viewing the QA Results
section.para: The QA Test results provide generic information such as the duration of the test and total failures detected. Below that, a list of rules and number of results are displayed. If you click on one of the rules, the second list below it called QA Run Details, will display the specific concepts that failed the test. Right-click to open the context menu and perform actions such as viewing the concept and copying the UUID.

mediaobject.alt: The details for a QA run includes the request time, complete time, status, duration, total QA failure, QA rules, and the error counts.
